images.caption: Figure 1:Highlights of the cost-of-pass framework and empirical analyses.Core concepts (left) set foundations for:(A)Comparing the Human Expert Baseline to the frontier achieved by the single most effective LM per task category.(B)Tracking the reduction in frontier cost-of-pass over time, indicating progress driven by new model releases (color-coded by family).(C)Quantifying the essential contribution of each model family: lightweight (less than $1 per million tokens), large, and reasoning; to the current cost-efficiency frontier, measured by the percentage of each familyâ€™s contribution.(D)Assessing the economic benefit (relative cost reduction) achieved by applying common inference-time techniques over the baseline model frontier (which rarely results in meaningful gains).
